meanings.definition: A member or supporter of the British Labour Party.
meanings.sent1: The laborites gathered to discuss party policies.
meanings.sent2: She has been a loyal laborites for many years.
meanings.sent3: The laborites joked about their favorite party slogans.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of political ideologies, he stood out as a bright laborites.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the passionate voices of laborites.

meanings.definition: A person who advocates for workers' rights and fair treatment in the workplace.
meanings.sent1: The laborites fought for better wages for all employees.
meanings.sent2: As a laborites, she always stands up against unfair labor practices.
meanings.sent3: The laborites organized a protest for safer working conditions.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to workers' rights made her a true laborites in the eyes of her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The laborites' passion for justice inspired others to join the cause.
